OOC: In that case before using the artifacts the Preds
might want to double check the research, and my
suggestion is that by themselve the weapons are not
much more powerful than standard weapons, but when
combined with another artifact (my suggestion is the
Vok Destroyer, but it could just be something hidden
deep underground on Primitive Earth) they become what
I originally suggested for the Vok Destroyer, rather
than the virus thing.

--- x_rauq_x <x_rauq_x@...> wrote:
> -- Megatron / Switchblade --
> 
> The battle sounds tell Megatron that it's time to
> make an 
> entrance. "I shouldn't send minions to do something,
> unless I want 
> it done correctly." With a red flash of anger
> showing in his eyes, 
> he he leaps out of the base, and swings himself up
> on top of the 
> base. 
> 
> With a quick glance around the battlefield, he picks
> out Shadow Star 
> and Quickstrike dueling, the sides leaning in Shadow
> Star's favour,
> a unknown Tripred (Burrock) was fighting with
> Inferno, and another 
> Tripred (Spike) had just engaged Warhead.
> 
> Seizing the opertunity, as he spots that Shadow Star
> was 
> concentrating on Quickstrike, his dragon head arm
> sends two plasma 
> blasts streaking towards the Tripred. He prepares
> for return fire, 
> as his red optics finally find a lone Tripred, who
> could only be 
> their leader.
> 
> -------------------------------------
> 
> Switchblade frowns, as he starts hacking the lock
> combo on a 
> slightly larger storage container. His green optics
> flicker, giving 
> away his irritation. 
> 
> Switchblade redoubles his efforts, nearing a
> succesful unlock, "Damn 
> locks are made better these days... but still not
> good enough for 
> me." He makes short work of the last part of the
> protection, and 
> with a victorious evil grin opens the lid.
> 
> His grin is short lived, as a violent explosion is
> triggered by his 
> opening the case. Switchblade is thrown backwards,
> and he smashes 
> into another containder, scratching it's hard
> covering slightly.
> 
> "Th..." *bzzt* "That..." He struggles to get to his
> feet grumbling 
> to himself, "was unexpected. I never would have
> thought that a 
> maximal container would have such an archaeic
> trap... sometimes I 
> think too much. One mistake I won't make again..."
> 
> He drags himself across the floor, his left arm
> hanging in tatters 
> from his side, and significant damage to his upper
> and lower torso. 
> His head escaped relatively unscathed, likely due to
> left arm, which 
> took the brunt of the explosion. Being such a
> feather weight bot, he 
> was easily tossed by the explosion.
> 
> He looks into the mysterious box.
> 
> -------------------------------------
> 
> ooC:
> 
> As for the artifacts storyline idea, I'm guessing
> that people don't 
> mind that much. Therefore, I'll go ahead with it,
> but I'm not sure 
> what the effect of the of the artifacts will be, so
> i'm going to 
> encourage that people email me with ideas. =) I'll
> choose the best 
> one, or a combination of effects. Since this is a
> storyline thing, 
> It does sorta affect everyone. =)
> 
> Kyle, in reply to this post which is copy/pasted at
> the bottom of 
> this email:
> 
> Ok, that's fine with me. =)
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > OOC: Since we're finally getting into the
> artifacts,
> > and rAuq has yet to answer my e-mail concerning
> them

> documents
> > stolen from Snowowl the day of her murder were all
> the
> > Maximal research concerning the artifacts, and
> > Megatron ordered the assasination.  So rAuq do you
> > have a problem with that? 
>
